name: Homewood Suites by Hilton Baltimore

reviews.title: Visiting Baltimore? The "Inner Harbor" and this property makes it a 10!
reviews.text: I am a frequent traveler. I am in hotels 80% of the year. This is a great hotel for a couple of important reasons. My first point: this is a very nice Homewood suites. It's new, modern, and the rooms are stylishly well appointed. Excellent kitchenette, flat screens in each room, very trendy sinks, baths and otther touches. Lastly, if you are a fitness lover you just found Mecca. Forget the workout room where the furniture was taken out of a room and treadmills are rolled in. This hotel -and a couple of others nearby- give you free access to a very spacious and modern health club thats connected to the hotels all sharing the same building. Complete with personal trainers, it's that good.

Second point: The Inner Harbor is Baltimore's revitalization project. It's an oasis of the city. Upscale, spacious, numerous restaurants of all ends, pubs, recreation, and tourist spots. Plenty of police quietly walking around and volunteer security personnel with theiy yellow jackets and flashing bicycle lights, you really can't go wrong with the Inner Harbor. To get an idea there's a Best Buy right across the street from the city Aquarium.
reviews.title: Good stay but with some setbacks

reviews.text: No hotel is perfect so I will list a couple of improvements that could be made. The Internet service is slow. I'm a network engineer so trust me this isn't u.s.e.r error. The hotel cable channel line up is pretty slim. I've gotten far more in small town motel chains. I'd expect more from an icon like this hotel. Lastly the check in/parking can get a little frustrated. The hotel is on one side of a divided 4 lane road that you have to go around a beautiful fountain rotary to get to. The check in parking area is tiny as it can be shared by cars that are parked on either side of this small pull up that are at a connected but separate restaurant. When I drove up ther ws no where to park just to check in. And so you have to drive allt eh way around again to the rotary or around a couple of blocks to get back around hoping a spot will open up just to check in. It can be very frustrating, especially on a Sunday evening. Have your bags ready because the regular parking area is behind the hotel in a connected parking garage that holds condo owners and guests of the Homewood suites and the Hilton Garden Inn. Also the parking is expensive. Its $25.00 a day or $195.00 for a 1 month pass. I guess considering the location that's somewhat understandable but $25.00 a day?
reviews.title: Great Stay!

reviews.text: So to sum it up, outside of a couple of spots this hotel hits the ball it to third base with some time to rest. Combining this very nice Homewood along with its excellent location you really can't go wrong.
reviews.title: never been served more competently

reviews.text: Lastly, kudos to "Donna" at the front desk. if only all front desk employees (including a couple at this Homewood) had her compassion and thoughtfulness.
reviews.title: terrific experience, great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having checked all the hotel reviews here on Tripadvisor, my girlfriend and I chose Homewood Suites because of its location, value, and extras. We made the right choice.
reviews.title: Homewood Suites is the right choice for Inner Harbor...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The king size bed suite is just right for two people for a weekend. The bed was comfy and kitchenette was handy. As another reviewer mentioned, the only problem is the bathroom does not include a vanity, and the vanity/sink area lights up the bedroom. We even had a bit of a view of the harbor from the 9th floor, although the hotel staff say there are no harbor views due to surrounding tall buildings.
reviews.title: Love the location, love the quiche!

reviews.text: The location of the Homewood Suites is excellent. Easy walking to Inner Harbor and Fells Point. Baltimore has terrific walking promenades all along the waterfront. Well lighted with attractive streetlights to enhance the enjoyment at night.
reviews.title: Great value

reviews.text: The value was also good, although the $22 parking per night and the room taxes will add a big chunk. The included breakfast is certainly hearty and large with eggs, sausage, bacon, potatoes, and all the usual fare. But the food was basically tasteless and the small dining room was crowded and noisy.
reviews.title: perfect choice for fun and relaxation

reviews.text: Overall, the Homewood Suites is the best choice for Baltimore. We would go there again, and recommend it highly.
reviews.title: You won't be disappointed

reviews.text: Had never been to Baltimore before - chose this hotel because of its location and because I wanted to use HHonors points. Loved the fact that it was a relatively new property and the location is perfect - walking distance to everything! Parking was a little confusing at first, but convenient once we found it (it's in the back of the hotel). All-in-all a great stay...will definitely stay there again when I am in Baltimore.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location!

reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel for a long weekend with our 4 children ages 2-9. The room worked out very nicely - especially for the price. The location is excellent. It's a walk to some of the attractions but we walked all the way to Camden Yards and back with our children. Very do able. Water taxi is very convenient and fun. Breakfast is acceptable - not great but it worked.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our only negative comment is about the pool. The pool is within the health club, not always available and there can only be 2 children per adult. Our whole idea was to bring the 3 older kids while 1 napped...no can do.
reviews.title: Just sit back and relax, Everything is so close if you decide to leave the room.

reviews.text: We were so pleased with our stay at the Homewood Suites. The room was clean and spacious. There's a Whole Foods Market so close by if you want a healthy meal or yummy treat. The staff was very kind helpful and certainly professional. Parking was a little odd- just make sure you unload your luggage at the front when you check in because you will have to park around back and take an elevator to the lobby. You may even want to take your luggage up to your room. All in all the room was so comfortable that we spent a lot of time just relaxing. The complimentary light dinner (during the week) and breakfast was a pleasant surprise. We will certainly go back to Homewood Suites on our next trip to Baltimore.
reviews.title: Worst Service Ever!!!

reviews.text: I am a Hilton Honors V.I.P. and a faithful guest. I have been staying in Baltimore while out of school for summer break. I arrived at Hilton Garden on Thursday May 7, 2009. I thought that this location was beautiful and that I would truly enjoy my stay. However since here, I have been treated very rudely! I will only mention the incidents that have really truly upset me. I must advise that I checked out for the first time since May 7 on May14 because of the rudeness from Donna the manager at the front desk, but the location I moved to was not what I was looking for. I wanted to be close to the water and I flew in, so I needed to be somewhere where everything was in walking distance, which the Homewood Inner Harbor location suited me perfectly. Sometimes I want a good home cooked meal while away from home, and here I can cook, and everything is very convenient. Well, I checked back in on Friday the 15th paying 195.00 covering me until Saturday morning. Saturday morning I enquired about the rate, and it was 139.00 plus tax, so I paid 300.00 to cover me until Monday the 18th. Sunday night I received a call from Donna the manager saying I needed to come down and pay. I explained to her that I already paid. She said, "no you need to come down and pay, or else I will have to have security come down and escort you out of your room. I then (with a little extra bass in my voice) said that I have already paid, and you are dead wrong, and I will need an apology tomorrow, and I will be contacting the manager! She then said " I guess we'll just have to send you some more free stuff!!! I was completely floored! I then decided that these calls needed to be recorded just in case they did put me out 6 hours away from home in a room that I had paid for, than that was completely grounds for a law suit! I then called back and Skylar answered the phone. I tried to explain to her that they were wrong in a very calm manner She would not agree even after I completely explained how, when, and who I paid! They also disconnected my phone not allowing me to call out. This a.m. when I woke, I went downstairs and requested the manager contact me because I was still very upset, even now writing this, I am fuming! I called and called for the manager, My call finally reaching him at 2 p.m. He told me he would speak to Scott TOMORROW! Are you kidding me???? And also, for me to lay down and get some rest or go out and get some fresh air! Really, what is that supposed to do?!. I called back down when 2nd shift got here actually trying to give one of these ladies a chance to apologize. Skylar answered,. and I said " So, you guys were wrong!" She did not apologize, but did admit that I was caught up on my room last night while being harassed at 10:15 p.m. I do have taped phone calls on my cell phone. My mother taught me very well! I document and record everything. I then asked for corporate number, she said 1-800-HILTON. After calling that number and seeing that was not enough numbers, I then called back up front and Donna answered. I then told het that I would never need anything for free, I have paid more e money in my room than what she makes in a month and I will never need anything for free, after all my house isn’t sitting in a puddle! I said this because no manager has taken care of this issue, and they have been able to say what they want to me, no manager has stepped in, so obviously I need to step up and say something! I was almost in tears last night- tears of anger, humiliation, and I am still extremely upset! I have spoke to Katrina from corporate and she was in disbelief, she gave me several apologies, which I can't say for the hotel. She has promised that both ladies will formally apologize to me this week, and I can't wait! Karma is something! I will write my reviews and pass this on to whoever until this issue gets solved! Corporate has promised satisfaction in 3 days, no more than that!
reviews.title: Very Nice Stay at Homewood Suites Baltimore!

reviews.text: We took our two kids - ages almost 6 and 4 1/2 - to Baltimore for a couple nights. I chose Homewood off the Internet. It's nicer in real life than on the web. Rooms are impeccably clean and smartly designed. Guests can use the MAC health club that attached to the hotel. Club is incredible for all needs and has a wonderful pool for kids (in addition to a lap pool). Location is an easy walk to all Inner Harbor attractions.
reviews.title: Perfect location; clean, neat rooms; awesome pool; good b'fast.
nice hotel, good price, would stay here again
reviews.text: We spent one night in a studio suite with king bed last weekend. Overall our experience was very good and we wished we were staying another night. The room was very nice - and very clean. The kitchen was updated, clean, and had everything you would need if you wanted to cook, a big fridge, plus a kitchen bar with 2 seats. The big screened tv rotated, so you could lay in bed and watch, or turn it around to face the living room area. The bed was very comfortable, although I didn't care for the light fluffy pillows (I personally prefer a more weighted, heavier pillow). The only thing about the layout of the room I didn't like was the bathroom/vanity area. The bathroom had the shower and toilet in it, but the sink/mirror is outside the bathroom in the vanity area. While I was getting ready in the morning, at the vanity area, I had to turn the lights on, which are very bright and woke my 20 month old and husband. There is no door separating the vanity area from the bedroom area. I personally like to have privacy when getting ready and would prefer for there to be a door there ( at least just for keeping the bright lights from others sleeping still). That was really the only thing I didn't like. I loved the complementary hot breakfast in the morning. We ate so much, we actually skipped lunch that day. They had everything you could want - eggs, bacon, sausage, some kind of grits, potatoes, oatmeal, cereal, milk, coffee, fruit, yogurt, tea, juice, bagels, toast, muffins... We got down there early and it wasn't busy at all. They even brought out a high chair for our little one. After breakfast, we headed to the aquarium ( about 5-10 min. walk). We requested a late checkout and they said we could check out at 1:00. (12:00 is the usual checkout time). You are allowed to keep your car in the lot until 4:00 pm without getting charged additional $ too, which is nice if you want extra time to do whatever you want, without having to worry about moving your car. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will prob. stay here again next time we are in Baltimore.

In our stay last summer, we arrived early in Baltimore and decided to try to check in at the hotel. The woman at the front desk was pleasant and said to come back at 1:00pm. We then asked her to make sure that two cribs or pack and plays would be available since we have 1 year old twins. She said not a problem and she would mark it on our reservation and call housekeeping to confirm. With this, my family embarked on our way to the Inner Harbor. When we returned at 1:45pm to check in, there was a different gentleman at the desk, we checked in and asked about the cribs. He was also pleasant and professional and stated that he did not see them on the reservation, but he would call housekeeping to make sure that our request would be filled. A little annoyed but assured, we went up to the room so that our twins could take their afternoon nap. They slept on the floor, but my wife made sure and slept right beside them for safety. They had just begun to walk, so we did not want them wandering in the dark if they woke up early. After nap, we decided to leave for dinner. We decided to check one more time to make sure that the cribs would be in the room when we returned so that the twins could go to bed. Another woman was at the front desk. This time she stated that there were no available cribs in the entire hotel. There was no apology, no empathy, not even an "I'm sorry". My wife then inquired and told of the promises from the earlier employees to the same robotic response.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel - Terrible Service

reviews.text: If not for this, the hotel was very nice. Good breakfast in the morning. Great location. Great price. I am not sure if I will stay there again.
reviews.title: Brilliant value for money!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First impressions count and I was not disappointed. On arrival I realised the location of the hotel was perfect for our needs. The hotel building was very nice and the reception area very smart and clean. We approached the reception staff who immediately came to our aid and were most efficient and friendly. The male receptionist was fantastic, he asked if we had any preferences as to where our room was and realising we had a teenage daughter with us he immediately upgraded us to a one-bedroomed suite which had amazing views on two sides with huge panoramic windows. There was bags of space and a wonderfully comfy bed! Everything possible had been provided for our needs including free coffee etc but what surprised us the most was that there was even free dinner in the restaurant! So a big up to the hotel and it's staff who were all very helpful and sooo friendly. I will definitely stay here again as I often visit this area.
reviews.title: Best Hotel stay EVER
